IMG_20230222_1625381961920×2560 207 KB

We cannot figure out how these two
Pieces are supposed to go together. The spline teeth are always off. Are we nuts?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T21:34:29.295Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":66.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":427755,"topic_slug":"rev-ion-sprocket-and-bearing-block-wont-align","display_username":"FredK","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/0/3/03182e3000613557a1661eb67bc6a31c0016e7b6.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/rev-ion-sprocket-and-bearing-block-wont-align/427755/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3150794,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T21:49:51.404Z","cooked":"

This is the 1x2 MAXSpline Bearing Block behind it, right? Turn it 90 degrees from how you have it - the holes centered above/below the spline pattern on the block line up with the center of the 3 hole pattern on either side in the gear. It means you’re attaching it to the sprocket with two bolts - and those two holes have recesses on the back side for the bolt head, which we’ve found to be a great feature for mounting!
